schedule.title: Rethinking the Web Platform
schedule.description: Evolving the web to improve education, accessibility, performance, productivity, and design.

schedule.title: If you're going out of San Francisco, be sure to wear Web Standards in your hair
schedule.description: We do like our Holy Wars, don't we?: tables vs CSS? Responsive vs mdot? React vs Angular? CSS or CSS-in-JS? Let's look at the real issue: getting the free and open web to the other 4 billion people.

schedule.title: How the web sausage gets made
schedule.description: They say there's two things you never want to see made: sausages and web standards. Sooooo I'm going to tell you about both! How do browsers work? What are web components even? Everyone's using them and maybe you should too! üÜíüê±üéâ

schedule.title: Lessons learned sciencing the web
schedule.description: Discover what slows down modern apps on mobile and how to fix this.

schedule.title: My Password Doesn't Work!
schedule.description: Security is important, but it doesn't have to be complex. Let's dispel myths and assuage fear associated with those linchpin of our online lives ‚Äì passwords ‚Äì and build toward a more secure and more usable web.

schedule.title: Memory: Don't Forget to Take Out the Garbage
schedule.description: JavaScript does a remarkable job of hiding memory management from us. What's going on behind the scenes?

schedule.title: Abstract art in a time of minification
schedule.description: aesthetic is a major component of any medium for art, including the web, but one thing that has been bothering me lately is: what happened to "view source"? are we destroying aesthetic for the sake of tooling and in spite of access to our industry????¬ø¬ø¬ø¬ø

schedule.title: Alpha, Beta, Gamer: Dev Mode
schedule.description: A live performance of video games and stand up comedy from comedian and coder, including pre prepared web games to play and even creating a video game with the audience on stage in only 10 minutes.
